name: Margery Wood, Walton Heath and Colley Hill Walk, Harewoods

ai.summary: A scenic 11.2 km moderate hike through Margery Wood, Walton Heath and Colley Hill near Harewoods in the UK. The route combines woodland trails, open heathland and gentle climbs, suitable for hikers with moderate fitness and good footwear.
ai.terrain_summary: Starts in Margery Wood, then follows diverse terrain across heathland and woodland. Expect well maintained paths, occasional forest tracks, sections with exposed roots, and mud after rain. The climb onto Colley Hill offers views but remains relatively gentle with uneven ground and some loose gravel.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and daylight hours before setting out. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Stay on marked paths, especially in heathland where wind and open ground can be exposed. Bring a map or GPS and a charged phone. Carry enough water and snacks. Inform someone of your plans and expected return time. Mind weather and temperature changes; watch for mud, damp leaves, and potential cyclist or horse traffic on shared tracks. In spring and summer use sun protection and insect repellent; watch for ticks in heathland.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Waterproof and breathable jacket and layered clothing
Map and compass or GPS device
Water bottle or hydration system (1–2 liters)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn, with caution in winter due to mud and shorter daylight.

seo.title: Margery Wood, Walton Heath and Colley Hill Walk – 11.2 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover an 11.2 km moderate hike through Margery Wood, Walton Heath and Colley Hill in the UK. Varied terrain, practical safety tips, and gear recommendations for a rewarding day out.
